info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 12:58PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Flatrock River near Columbus.
East Fork White River at Columbus.
Big Blue River at Shelbyville.
East Fork White River at Shoals.
...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Indiana...
East Fork White River at Seymour.
East Fork White River near Bedford.
.Significant and some major flooding is expected to develop along the East Fork White River due to several rounds of heavy rainfall through Sunday. Wednesday night rainfall of generally one to three inches fell across the East Fork White basin. Additional rainfall of five to seven inches in the East Fork White basin is expected through Sunday morning, and this is all included in today's forecasts.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Flatrock River near Columbus.
* WHEN...From Friday morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Extensive flooding in progress along the Flatrock River. Portions of Riverside Drive north of US Highway 31 are flooded. According to the Columbus Response Plan... Indianapolis Road is flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to 11.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon and then rise to 15.7 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 400 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
